summary: Armenian is a unique Indo-European language spoken by the Armenian people. It's the official language of Armenia and has its own alphabet, created in the 5th century by Saint Mesrop Mashtots. This language is used by around 5 to 7 million people worldwide, not only in Armenia but also in the Armenian diaspora. It's known for its distinct sound and script, making it an important part of Armenian culture and history.
title: Armenian language
